metadata.titleCn: 喜马拉雅山区1:200万主要水系（2013）
metadata.description: HydroRIVERS represents a vectorized line network of all global rivers that have a catchment area of at least 10 km² or an average river flow of at least 0.1 m³/sec, or both. HydroRIVERS has been extracted from the gridded HydroSHEDS core layers at 15 arc-second resolution. The global coverage of HydroRIVERS encompasses 8.5 million individual river reaches with an average length of 4.2 km, representing a total of 35.9 million km of rivers globally. HydroRIVERS only includes a limited amount of (mostly geometric) attribute information, such as the river reach length, the distance from upstream headwaters and ocean outlet, the river order, and an estimate of long-term average discharge. Every river reach is also co-registered to the sub-basin of the HydroBASINS database in which it resides (via a shared ID).
metadata.descriptionCn: 水系是一种重要的自然要素，它的发育、形态及分布是多种因素综合作用的结果。喜马拉雅水系所使用的数据集是Global river network delineation derived from HydroSHEDS data at 15 arc-second resolution。HydroRIVERS数据集水区至少为10 km²或平均河流流量至少为0.1 m³/sec或两者兼而有之的所有全球河流的矢量化线网络。以15弧秒（约500米）的分辨率从网格化的HydroSHEDS核心层中提取。包含属性信息，如河流长度、上游源头和出海口的距离、河流秩序和长期平均流量的估计等。本数据集由几何信息支持，允许分析基本的河流网络拓扑，例如上下游连通性和距离。另外，提供了水文数据层，允许根据高分辨率SRTM数字高程模型导出任何给定位置的河网。HydroRIVERS数据集水区至少为10 km²或平均河流流量至少为0.1 m³/sec或两者兼而有之的所有全球河流的矢量化线网络。以15弧秒（约500米）的分辨率从网格化的HydroSHEDS核心层中提取。包含属性信息，如河流长度、上游源头和出海口的距离、河流秩序和长期平均流量的估计等。数据来源于https://www.hydrosheds.org/products/hydrorivers。
metadata.instructions: The Himalayas drainage distribution (2013) data reading method: the data set all of the images can be directly opened by ArcGIS;

background: Water is a vital necessity to sustain life on Earth, and many Earth system processes depend on the spatial and temporal distribution of freshwater resources. The hydrological cycle and its underlying physical processes have been studied intensely over the past decades, mostly with a focus on small- to medium-sized catchments. In recent years, however, the increasing pressures on freshwater resources from a multitude of complex and interacting factors that span all scales led to a growing recognition of the importance of large river systems. As in situ measurements of many hydrologic variables at large spatial and temporal scales are difficult and expensive, global hydrological models (GHMs) have emerged as our preferred research tool to analyze current and future world water resources. Despite the increased attention, hydrological modeling at large scales has traditionally been hampered by a number of issues, including general limitations in our knowledge and understanding of the underlying processes for many regions of the Earth; incomplete, inconsistent, or highly uncertain data collections; a lack of spatial integration between models and datasets; and the difficulty to create models that support multi-scale or coupled approaches. To achieve this goal, new and enhanced global datasets and tools describing the geographical distribution of hydrological features, characteristics, and processes will be required as this information is currently often unavailable or at low quality.

Spatial information in GHMs is typically represented as layers of uniformly sized grid cells, also known as raster datasets. Vector datasets on the other hand consist of objects, represented as points at a certain location, or as a series of point locations chained together to form a line or polygon. Raster models have traditionally been the preferred choice of hydrological modelers since the integration of topography in the form of rasterized Digital Elevation Models (DEMs) is a key requirement for many routing algorithms that trace water along drainage direction maps. Furthermore, many ancillary datasets stem from remotely sensed raster information (e.g. land cover, precipitation, etc.), and grids are relatively easy to process in any modern GIS. Hydrological connectivity is an important concept in both hydrology and ecology. Flows in traditional GHMs that include lateral transport occur on the premise of a river continuum whereby conditions at every location in the river network are influenced by upstream processes (Vannote et al., 1980). The advanced implementation of hydrological connectivity in a modeling framework is an attractive concept because of its ability to integrate processes from multiple disciplines (such as terrestrial, climate, ecological and hydrological); because of its easiness to represent spatially explicit topology information of a river network and watershed landscape (up- and downstream relations); and because of its intrinsic ability to establish connections across multiple scales– from point locations and river reaches to nested catchments and entire basins.

The main limitations identified are related to spatial resolution, data structure, quality of data, inclusion of hydrological connectivity, and support of multi-scale and integrated modeling approaches.
research objective: In this paper, we argue that there is currently no comprehensive framework that can fully support integrated hydro-ecological modeling at the global scale; yet the building blocks of such a framework already exist. We will illustrate the current status and outline new directions for global scale hydro-ecological modeling to study the world’s large river systems. We propose an approach that combines existing and newly developed global scale hydrographic baseline data with a dedicated river routing model in a Geographic Information System (GIS) environment, and we will present preliminary results of our own model development. Finally, we will show that such a framework can enable a broad range of hydro-ecological applications and operate at scales at which local decision making and management becomes feasible.

We here propose to design a more integrated data and modeling framework which facilitates an easier linkage between hydrological and ecological information and is geared towards hydro-ecological research, applications, and management. In conclusion and to widen the scope of routing, tracing, and connectivity in hydrological models, for this paper, we define the term ‘river network routing’ following the hydrological connectivity concept of Pringle (2003) as ‘the simulation of movement of energy, material and species within a hydrological object space, based on flow routing, tracing and in-stream processing.’
In response, we proposed a versatile global hydrological modeling framework that addresses these limitations, providing support for a broad range of applications.
challenges: Despite significant recent advancements, global hydrological models and their input databases still show limited capabilities in supporting many spatially detailed research questions and integrated assessments, such as required in freshwater ecology or applied water resources management. The current spatial resolution of GHMs is not appropriate for many ecological or environmental management applications because of difficulties to accurately represent stream and watershed attributes and to precisely locate individual objects within the river system. The relatively coarse spatial resolution introduces bias and misrepresentation of hydrological processes and river topology. This can result, for example, in underestimation of river length and travel times and can lead to subsequent inaccuracies of travel-based attributes, e.g., sediment delivery to the ocean. The integration of local or fine-scale information is difficult, if not impossible.

A major limitation of the raster concept, however, is the difficulty to integrate objects or information from different sources or formats (such as the discharge time series of a gauging station; a reservoir outline; or a fish migration route) into one common framework, as linkages would have to be established to individual pixels. Yet, difficulties arise from inherent data and modeling characteristics. For example, certain types of geospatial hydrological data, such as runoff coefficients or flow directions, cannot be easily scaled by spatial resampling techniques. We are currently not aware of models that can fully implement such advanced up- and downstream routing in a global framework. Thus, for the primary goal of a first-level integration of baseline hydrology with ecological and other applications at the global scale, we believe that the full implementation of hydrodynamic processes, though desirable, is currently not a stringent priority.

The main limitations identified are related to spatial resolution, data structure, quality of data, inclusion of hydrological connectivity, and support of multi-scale and integrated modeling approaches.
methods: We described the enhancement of a global hydrographic database (HydroSHEDS) and the coupled development of a new river network routing model (HydroROUT) as the backbone of our framework.
dataset: HydroSHEDS is a hydrographic mapping product created by World Wildlife Fund that provides river and watershed information for regional and global-scale applications in a consistent format (Lehner et al., 2008). It offers a suite of geo-referenced datasets at various resolutions ranging from 3 arc-second (approximately 90 m at the equator) to 30 arc-second, including river networks, watershed boundaries, and drainage directions. In nearly all GHMs, the implemented routing models operate on raster data. Only recently, some large-scale models started to shift towards a vector environment (e.g. Paiva et al., 2011) or use advanced sub-grid and/or hybrid structures (e.g. Yamazaki et al., 2011).
findings: Our case studies showed the potential of the model and data development to facilitate and conduct hydro-ecological research at the global scale.
backgroundCn: 水是维持地球生命的必要条件，许多地球系统过程依赖于淡水资源的空间和时间分布。水文循环及其基础物理过程在过去几十年中得到了深入研究，主要集中在小到中型流域。然而，近年来，由于来自多种复杂和相互作用因素的压力不断增加，淡水资源的重要性得到了越来越多的关注，这些因素跨越了所有尺度。因此，越来越认识到大型河流系统的重要性。由于在大空间和时间尺度上对许多水文变量进行现场测量既困难又昂贵，全球水文模型（GHMs）已成为我们分析当前和未来世界水资源的首选研究工具。尽管关注度增加，但在大尺度上的水文建模传统上受到许多问题的制约，包括我们对地球许多地区基础过程的知识和理解的普遍局限性；数据收集的不完整、不一致或高度不确定性；模型与数据集之间缺乏空间整合；以及创建支持多尺度或耦合方法的模型的困难。为了实现这一目标，需要新的和增强的全球数据集和工具，以描述水文特征、特性和过程的地理分布，因为这些信息目前往往不可用或质量较低。

GHMs中的空间信息通常以均匀大小的网格单元层（也称为栅格数据集）表示。另一方面，矢量数据集由对象组成，这些对象以某个位置的点表示，或以一系列连接在一起的点位置形成线或多边形。栅格模型传统上是水文模型者的首选，因为以栅格化数字高程模型（DEMs）形式集成地形是许多沿水流方向图的路由算法的关键要求。此外，许多辅助数据集源于遥感栅格信息（例如，土地覆盖、降水等），并且在任何现代GIS中处理网格相对简单。水文连通性是水文学和生态学中的一个重要概念。传统GHMs中包含侧向输送的流动基于河流连续体的前提，即河流网络中每个位置的条件都受到上游过程的影响（Vannote等，1980）。在建模框架中高级实施水文连通性是一个有吸引力的概念，因为它能够整合来自多个学科的过程（如陆地、气候、生态和水文）；因为它易于表示河流网络和流域景观的空间显式拓扑信息（上下游关系）；并且因为它固有的能力能够在多个尺度上建立连接——从点位置和河段到嵌套流域和整个流域。
主要识别的限制与空间分辨率、数据结构、数据质量、水文连通性的纳入以及对多尺度和综合建模方法的支持有关。
research objectiveCn: 在本文中，我们认为目前尚不存在一个能够全面支持全球范围内综合水文生态建模的框架；然而，这样框架的基本构件已经存在。我们将阐述当前的状态，并概述全球范围内水文生态建模的新方向，以研究世界的大型河流系统。我们提出一种方法，将现有和新开发的全球水文基线数据与专门的河流流动模型结合在地理信息系统（GIS）环境中，并将展示我们自己模型开发的初步结果。最后，我们将展示这样的框架能够支持广泛的水文生态应用，并在地方决策和管理变得可行的尺度上运行。
我们在此提议设计一个更为综合的数据和建模框架，以便于水文和生态信息之间的更容易链接，并且旨在支持水文生态研究、应用和管理。最后，为了拓宽水文模型中路由、追踪和连通性的范围，在本文中，我们根据Pringle（2003）的水文连通性概念定义“河流网络路由”一词为“基于流动路由、追踪和水体内处理，模拟能量、物质和物种在水文对象空间内的运动。”
我们提出了一个多功能的全球水文模型框架，以应对这些局限性，为广泛的应用提供支持。
challengesCn: 尽管最近在全球水文模型及其输入数据库方面取得了显著进展，但它们在支持许多空间详细的研究问题和综合评估方面仍显示出有限的能力，例如在淡水生态学或应用水资源管理中所需的能力。目前全球水文模型的空间分辨率对于许多生态或环境管理应用并不合适，因为难以准确表示河流和流域特征，并且无法精确定位河流系统中的单个对象。相对粗糙的空间分辨率引入了偏差和水文过程及河流拓扑的误表示。这可能导致河流长度和流动时间的低估，从而导致基于流动的属性（例如，沉积物输送到海洋的准确性）的后续不准确性。整合地方或细尺度信息是困难的，甚至是不可能的。

然而，栅格概念的一个主要局限性是将来自不同来源或格式的信息（例如，测流站的排水时间序列、一个水库的轮廓或鱼类迁徙路线）整合到一个共同框架中的困难，因为必须将链接建立到单个像素。然而，由于固有的数据和建模特性，困难随之而来。例如，某些类型的地理空间水文数据，如径流系数或流向，无法通过空间重采样技术轻易缩放。目前我们尚未发现能够在全球框架内完全实现这种先进的上下游水流路由的模型。因此，对于将基线水文学与生态和其他应用在全球范围内进行初步整合的主要目标而言，尽管全面实施水动力过程是可取的，但目前并不是一个严格的优先事项。
主要识别的限制与空间分辨率、数据结构、数据质量、水文连通性的纳入以及对多尺度和综合建模方法的支持有关。
methodsCn: 我们描述了全球水文数据库（HydroSHEDS）的增强以及新河流网络路由模型（HydroROUT）的联合开发，作为我们框架的核心。
datasetCn: HydroSHEDS是由世界自然基金会创建的水文制图产品，提供区域和全球尺度应用的河流和流域信息，格式一致（Lehner et al., 2008）。它提供了一套不同分辨率的地理参考数据集，分辨率范围从3弧秒（在赤道大约为90米）到30弧秒，包括河流网络、流域边界和排水方向。在几乎所有的全球水文模型（GHMs）中，实施的水流模型都在栅格数据上运行。仅最近，一些大规模模型开始转向矢量环境（例如Paiva et al., 2011）或使用先进的子网格和/或混合结构（例如Yamazaki et al., 2011）。
findingsCn: 我们的案例研究显示了模型和数据开发在全球范围内促进和开展水生态研究的潜力。

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Is the primary data collection method for large river systems based on satellite imagery, in situ measurements, or global hydrological models?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 大型河流系统的主要数据收集方法是基于卫星影像、现场测量还是全球水文模型？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Are challenges in data collection for hydrological modeling primarily related to spatial resolution, data structure, or hydrological connectivity?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 水文建模中数据收集的挑战主要与空间分辨率、数据结构或水文连通性有关吗？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Are datasets for river network routing more commonly represented in raster format, vector format, or hybrid structures?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 河流网络路由的数据集更常见的是以栅格格式、矢量格式还是混合结构表示？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What is the primary source of data for delineating the global river network in the Himalayas?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 确定喜马拉雅山脉全球河流网络的主要数据来源是什么？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: Where can challenges be encountered when integrating hydrological and ecological data at a global scale?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在全球范围内整合水文和生态数据时可能会遇到哪些挑战？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: Who developed the HydroSHEDS hydrographic mapping product used for global-scale applications?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: HydroSHEDS水文测绘产品是由谁开发的，用于全球范围的应用？

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used for understanding river network topology in global hydrological models?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于理解全球水文模型中河流网络拓扑的数据收集方法的示例？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a data collection method is the use of HydroSHEDS, which is a hydrographic mapping product that provides river and watershed information for regional and global-scale applications. It includes geo-referenced datasets at various resolutions, such as river networks and drainage directions, allowing for analysis of river network topology.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个数据收集方法的例子是使用HydroSHEDS，这是一种水文制图产品，提供区域和全球尺度的河流和流域信息。它包括各种分辨率的地理参考数据集，如河流网络和排水方向，允许对河流网络拓扑进行分析。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you give an example of a dataset that supports multi-scale hydrological modeling approaches?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个支持多尺度水文建模方法的数据集示例？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a dataset supporting multi-scale hydrological modeling is HydroRIVERS, which provides a vectorized line network of global rivers with attributes like river length and average flow estimates. This dataset supports analyses of river network topology and hydrological connectivity at various scales.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个支持多尺度水文建模的数据集是HydroRIVERS，它提供了全球河流的矢量化线网络，并包含河流长度和平均流量估计等属性。该数据集支持在不同尺度上对河流网络拓扑和水文连通性的分析。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the key characteristics of a global hydrological model's spatial resolution and its impact on data quality?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 全球水文模型的空间分辨率的关键特征及其对数据质量的影响是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: coarse spatial resolution, biases, misrepresentation of hydrological processes, misrepresentation of river topology, underestimation of river length, underestimation of travel times
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 粗略的空间分辨率、偏差、水文过程的误表示、河流拓扑的误表示、河流长度的低估、行程时间的低估。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What specific features of vector datasets make them suitable for representing hydrological connectivity and river network topology?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 向量数据集的哪些具体特征使其适合表示水文连通性和河流网络拓扑？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: points, lines, polygons, spatially explicit representation, topology information, up- and downstream relations, connections across multiple scales
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 点、线、多边形、空间显式表示、拓扑信息、上下游关系、跨多个尺度的连接

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the minimum drainage area or average river flow required for inclusion in the global river network dataset?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 全球河流网络数据集中包含的最小排水面积或平均河流流量是多少？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many arc-seconds resolution does the HydroSHEDS dataset offer for global river and watershed mapping?
Quantification.QuestionCn: HydroSHEDS 数据集提供全球河流和流域制图的分辨率为多少角秒？

Definition.QuestionEn: How does spatial resolution impact the effectiveness of global hydrological models?
Definition.QuestionCn: 空间分辨率如何影响全球水文模型的有效性？
Definition.AnswerEn: The spatial resolution of global hydrological models significantly impacts their effectiveness, as the current resolutions are often not suitable for ecological or environmental management applications. Coarse spatial resolution can lead to inaccuracies in representing stream and watershed attributes, misrepresentation of river topology, and misestimation of river length and travel times. This can subsequently cause inaccuracies in travel-based attributes, such as sediment delivery to the ocean.
Definition.AnswerCn: 全球水文模型的空间分辨率对其有效性有显著影响，因为当前的分辨率通常不适合生态或环境管理应用。粗糙的空间分辨率可能导致在表示河流和流域特征时的不准确，河流拓扑的错误表示，以及河流长度和旅行时间的误估。这可能会导致基于旅行的属性的不准确，例如向海洋输送沉积物的量。

Definition.QuestionEn: What role does the HydroSHEDS dataset play in global hydrological modeling?
Definition.QuestionCn: HydroSHEDS 数据集在全球水文建模中扮演着什么角色？
Definition.AnswerEn: The HydroSHEDS dataset provides hydrographic mapping products that offer river and watershed information for regional and global-scale applications in a consistent format. It includes geo-referenced datasets like river networks, watershed boundaries, and drainage directions at various resolutions, which are crucial for developing routing models and enhancing global hydrological databases. HydroSHEDS serves as the foundation for the development of models that facilitate hydro-ecological research and applications.
Definition.AnswerCn: HydroSHEDS 数据集提供水文映射产品，提供区域和全球尺度的河流和流域信息，以一致的格式呈现。它包括地理参考数据集，如河流网络、流域边界和排水方向，具有不同的分辨率，这些数据对于开发水流模型和增强全球水文数据库至关重要。HydroSHEDS 是开发模型的基础，这些模型促进了水文生态研究和应用。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the main challenges faced in integrating hydrological and ecological datasets on a global scale compared to regional scales?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在全球范围内整合水文和生态数据集相比于区域范围面临的主要挑战是什么？
Comparison.AnswerEn: On a global scale, the integration of hydrological and ecological datasets is challenged by limitations in spatial resolution, data structure, and the quality of data, which impede the accurate representation of stream and watershed attributes. Regional scales can often manage finer details and local information more effectively. Global scales require new frameworks to support multi-scale approaches and better integration of hydrological connectivity.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在全球范围内，水文和生态数据集的整合面临空间分辨率、数据结构和数据质量的限制，这妨碍了对河流和流域特征的准确表示。区域尺度通常能够更有效地管理更细致的细节和地方信息。全球尺度需要新的框架来支持多尺度方法，并更好地整合水文连通性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges do current global hydrological models face in accurately representing stream and watershed attributes, and how might new datasets address these issues?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 当前全球水文模型在准确表示河流和流域特征方面面临哪些挑战，以及新数据集如何解决这些问题？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Current global hydrological models face challenges such as coarse spatial resolution, leading to biases in river length, travel times, and hydrological processes. These inaccuracies can affect attributes like sediment delivery and ecological dynamics. New datasets, possibly with higher resolution and improved data structures, could provide more precise stream and watershed representations, thus enhancing model accuracy for ecological and water resource management applications.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 当前全球水文模型面临着诸多挑战，例如空间分辨率较粗，导致河流长度、流动时间和水文过程的偏差。这些不准确性可能影响沉积物输送和生态动态等属性。新的数据集，可能具有更高的分辨率和改进的数据结构，可以提供更精确的溪流和流域表示，从而提高模型在生态和水资源管理应用中的准确性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the underlying reasons for the challenges faced in integrating multi-scale and coupled approaches in global hydrological modeling?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在全球水文建模中，整合多尺度和耦合方法所面临的挑战的根本原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The challenges in integrating multi-scale and coupled approaches in global hydrological modeling arise from several factors, including spatial resolution limitations, the quality and consistency of data, and the difficulty in representing accurate hydrological connectivity. The coarse spatial resolution can lead to misrepresentation of stream and watershed attributes, which affects the accuracy of hydrological models.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在全球水文建模中，整合多尺度和耦合方法面临的挑战源于多个因素，包括空间分辨率的限制、数据的质量和一致性，以及准确表示水文连通性的困难。粗糙的空间分辨率可能导致对河流和流域特征的错误表征，从而影响水文模型的准确性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the limited capabilities of global hydrological models in supporting spatially detailed research questions, particularly in freshwater ecology?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 全球水文模型在支持空间详细研究问题（特别是在淡水生态学方面）时能力有限的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The limited capabilities of global hydrological models in supporting spatially detailed research questions are primarily caused by the coarse spatial resolution of existing datasets, which introduces bias and misrepresentation of hydrological processes and river topology. This can lead to inaccuracies in attributes such as river length and travel times, which are crucial for ecological and environmental management applications.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 全球水文模型在支持空间详细研究问题方面的能力有限，主要是由于现有数据集的空间分辨率较粗，导致水文过程和河流地形的偏差和误表征。这可能导致河流长度和旅行时间等属性的不准确，而这些属性对于生态和环境管理应用至关重要。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How do challenges related to spatial resolution and data structure impact the effectiveness of global hydrological models in supporting ecological applications?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 空间分辨率和数据结构相关的挑战如何影响全球水文模型在支持生态应用中的有效性？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Challenges related to spatial resolution and data structure can significantly impact the effectiveness of global hydrological models by limiting their ability to accurately represent stream and watershed attributes. This can lead to misrepresentation of hydrological processes, such as river length and travel times, ultimately affecting the precision of ecological applications. The coarse spatial resolution often introduces biases, hindering the integration of fine-scale ecological information into global models.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 与空间分辨率和数据结构相关的挑战可能会显著影响全球水文模型的有效性，因为它们限制了模型准确表示河流和流域特征的能力。这可能导致水文过程的错误表征，例如河流长度和旅行时间，从而影响生态应用的精确性。粗糙的空间分辨率通常会引入偏差，妨碍将细尺度生态信息整合到全球模型中。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What potential advancements or outcomes could result from the enhancement of a global hydrographic database and the development of a new river network routing model?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 全球水文数据库的增强和新河流网络路由模型的发展可能带来的潜在进展或结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The enhancement of a global hydrographic database and the development of a new river network routing model could lead to significant advancements in hydro-ecological research. These improvements can provide a more integrated framework that supports multi-scale modeling and facilitates the linkage between hydrological and ecological information. This can enable a broader range of applications, enhance the analysis of large river systems, and improve the precision of environmental management and decision-making processes at various scales.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 全球水文数据库的增强和新河流网络路由模型的发展可能会在水生态研究方面带来重大进展。这些改进可以提供一个更为综合的框架，支持多尺度建模，并促进水文与生态信息之间的联系。这将使更广泛的应用成为可能，增强对大型河流系统的分析，并提高在各个尺度上环境管理和决策过程的精确性。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it significant to develop a comprehensive framework that supports integrated hydro-ecological modeling on a global scale?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么开发一个支持全球范围内综合水文生态建模的全面框架具有重要意义？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Developing a comprehensive framework for integrated hydro-ecological modeling on a global scale is significant because it addresses the limitations of current models, such as inadequate spatial resolution and data integration. Such a framework would allow for better linkage between hydrological and ecological information, supporting a diverse range of applications and management decisions. It would also facilitate the simulation of the movement of energy, material, and species within hydrological systems, enhancing the understanding and management of freshwater resources.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 开发一个全球范围内综合水文生态模型的框架具有重要意义，因为它解决了当前模型的局限性，例如空间分辨率不足和数据整合问题。这样的框架将更好地连接水文和生态信息，支持多种应用和管理决策。它还将促进能量、物质和物种在水文系统中的运动模拟，从而增强对淡水资源的理解和管理。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What objectives drive the enhancement of global hydrographic databases and the development of new river network routing models in this field?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 推动全球水文数据库增强和新河流网络路由模型发展的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objectives driving the enhancement of global hydrographic databases and the development of new river network routing models are to create more robust and versatile datasets that support accurate representation and analysis of river networks and watershed attributes. This includes improving spatial resolution, data structure, and quality, as well as incorporating hydrological connectivity to enable comprehensive hydro-ecological research and applications. These developments aim to overcome existing challenges in modeling and provide reliable data for global-scale studies and decision-making processes.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 推动全球水文数据库增强和新河流网络路由模型发展的目标是创建更强大和多功能的数据集，以支持河流网络和流域属性的准确表示和分析。这包括提高空间分辨率、数据结构和质量，以及纳入水文连通性，以便支持全面的水文生态研究和应用。这些发展旨在克服建模中的现有挑战，并为全球范围的研究和决策过程提供可靠的数据。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What is the procedure for creating a global hydrological model that integrates both raster and vector datasets effectively?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 创建一个有效整合栅格和矢量数据集的全球水文模型的程序是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The procedure involves enhancing a global hydrographic database such as HydroSHEDS and developing a coupled river network routing model, like HydroROUT, to serve as the framework's backbone. This approach allows for the integration of raster data, which is typically used for routing models, with vector data to improve spatial representation and connectivity in hydrological modeling.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 该程序涉及增强全球水文数据库，如HydroSHEDS，并开发一个耦合的河流网络路由模型，如HydroROUT，作为框架的核心。这种方法允许将通常用于路由模型的栅格数据与矢量数据相结合，以改善水文建模中的空间表示和连通性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can challenges related to spatial resolution and data structure be addressed when developing a dataset for large river systems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在开发大型河流系统的数据集时，如何解决与空间分辨率和数据结构相关的挑战？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Challenges related to spatial resolution and data structure can be addressed by employing global hydrological models that support multi-scale and integrated modeling approaches. Efforts should be made to enhance the spatial resolution of datasets, such as HydroSHEDS, to reduce bias and improve the accuracy of hydrological processes and river topology representation, ensuring precise location of stream and watershed attributes.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 与空间分辨率和数据结构相关的挑战可以通过采用支持多尺度和综合建模方法的全球水文模型来解决。应努力提高数据集的空间分辨率，例如HydroSHEDS，以减少偏差并提高水文过程和河流拓扑表示的准确性，确保流域和水流属性的精确位置。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methods are recommended for improving the quality and integration of hydrological datasets for large-scale ecological applications?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 推荐哪些方法来提高大规模生态应用中水文数据集的质量和整合？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Improving the quality and integration of hydrological datasets can be achieved by using advanced global datasets and tools like HydroSHEDS, which provide geo-referenced datasets at various resolutions. The integration of raster and vector datasets can be facilitated by using models that operate in a Geographic Information System (GIS) environment, allowing for spatially explicit representation and analysis of hydrological connectivity and processes across multiple scales.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 提高水文数据集的质量和整合性可以通过使用先进的全球数据集和工具，如HydroSHEDS，来实现，这些工具提供了不同分辨率的地理参考数据集。通过在地理信息系统（GIS）环境中使用模型，可以促进栅格和矢量数据集的整合，从而允许对水文连通性和过程在多个尺度上的空间显式表示和分析。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How does the integration of vector and raster data environments enable more comprehensive hydrological modeling at large scales?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 矢量和栅格数据环境的集成如何在大尺度上实现更全面的水文建模？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The integration of vector and raster data environments allows for the detailed representation of river networks and watershed landscapes, enhancing hydrological connectivity and enabling multi-scale and integrated modeling approaches.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 矢量和栅格数据环境的集成允许对河流网络和流域景观进行详细表示，增强水文连通性，并支持多尺度和综合建模方法。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions or methods enable the accurate estimation of river attributes such as length, flow direction, and connectivity in global hydrological models?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些条件或方法能够在全球水文模型中准确估计河流属性，如长度、流向和连通性？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Accurate estimation of river attributes is enabled by using high-resolution datasets, like those derived from HydroSHEDS, which provide detailed geographical distribution information and support advanced methods for hydrological connectivity and routing.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 高分辨率数据集（如HydroSHEDS）使得河流属性的准确估计成为可能，这些数据集提供了详细的地理分布信息，并支持先进的水文连通性和水流路由方法。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the integration of local or fine-scale information into global hydrological models be challenging, and how can this challenge be addressed?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么将局部或精细尺度信息整合到全球水文模型中可能具有挑战性，以及如何解决这一挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The integration of local or fine-scale information is challenging due to the coarse spatial resolution of global hydrological models, which can introduce bias and misrepresentation of hydrological processes and river topology. This difficulty arises from the inability to accurately represent stream and watershed attributes or precisely locate individual objects within the river system. Addressing this challenge requires the development of models that can incorporate advanced routing and connectivity concepts, which can facilitate a more accurate representation of spatially detailed research questions and integrated assessments.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 由于全球水文模型的空间分辨率较粗，整合地方或细尺度信息面临挑战，这可能导致水文过程和河流拓扑的偏差和误表示。这一困难源于无法准确表示溪流和流域特征，或精确定位河流系统内的单个对象。解决这一挑战需要开发能够融入先进的水流和连通性概念的模型，从而促进对空间详细研究问题和综合评估的更准确表示。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why do hydrological datasets often have limitations regarding spatial resolution and data structure, and what improvements could be made to enhance their usability for ecological applications?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么水文数据集在空间分辨率和数据结构方面经常存在局限性，哪些改进可以提高其在生态应用中的可用性？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Hydrological datasets often face limitations in spatial resolution and data structure because traditional models use raster data which can be difficult to integrate with diverse data types and formats, such as discharge time series or reservoir outlines. These limitations impact the ability to conduct spatially detailed research and integrate hydrological connectivity. Improvements could include developing more integrated data and modeling frameworks that support multi-scale approaches and facilitate easier linkage between hydrological and ecological information.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 水文数据集通常面临空间分辨率和数据结构的限制，因为传统模型使用栅格数据，这可能难以与多样的数据类型和格式（如流量时间序列或水库轮廓）进行整合。这些限制影响了进行空间详细研究和整合水文连通性的能力。改进措施可以包括开发更为综合的数据和建模框架，支持多尺度方法，并促进水文与生态信息之间的更容易链接。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the expected outcomes of enhancing global hydrographic databases with new river network routing models, and how might these enhancements support hydro-ecological research?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 增强全球水文数据库与新的河流网络路由模型的预期结果是什么，这些增强如何支持水文生态研究？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Enhancing global hydrographic databases with new river network routing models is expected to provide a framework that supports hydro-ecological research and management applications at a global scale. These enhancements can enable a broad range of applications by offering more detailed and accurate representation of river networks, which can improve the integration of ecological and hydrological information, facilitate the study of large river systems, and support local decision-making and management.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 通过新的河流网络路由模型增强全球水文数据库，预计将提供一个支持全球范围内水文生态研究和管理应用的框架。这些增强可以通过提供更详细和准确的河流网络表示，促进广泛的应用，改善生态和水文信息的整合，便于对大型河流系统的研究，并支持地方决策和管理。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you assess the potential for enhancing global hydro-ecological modeling with existing and new global hydrographic baseline data?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您如何评估利用现有和新的全球水文基线数据增强全球水生态建模的潜力？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The potential is significant, as combining existing and newly developed global hydrographic baseline data with dedicated river routing models in GIS environments can enable a broad range of hydro-ecological applications. This approach supports multi-scale integration and can facilitate local decision-making and management.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 潜力巨大，因为将现有和新开发的全球水文基线数据与专门的河流流向模型结合在GIS环境中，可以实现广泛的水文生态应用。这种方法支持多尺度整合，并能够促进地方决策和管理。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your opinion, what are the prospects for improving the quality and applicability of datasets used in global hydrological models through advancements in data collection techniques?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在您看来，通过数据收集技术的进步，提高用于全球水文模型的数据集的质量和适用性的前景如何？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Prospects for improvement are promising with the development of enhanced datasets and tools, such as HydroSHEDS and HydroROUT, which provide higher resolution and more consistent data for hydrological and ecological research. These advancements can address current limitations in spatial resolution, data quality, and integration, thereby broadening the scope and application of global hydrological models.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 改善的前景是乐观的，随着增强数据集和工具的发展，如HydroSHEDS和HydroROUT，它们为水文和生态研究提供了更高分辨率和更一致的数据。这些进展可以解决当前在空间分辨率、数据质量和集成方面的局限，从而扩大全球水文模型的范围和应用。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data collection methods can accurately represent stream and watershed attributes at a global scale.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白数据收集方法如何能够在全球范围内准确代表河流和流域特征。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The main limitations in global hydrological models and their input databases are related to spatial resolution, data structure, and quality of data, which can introduce biases and misrepresentations in stream and watershed attributes. These challenges make it difficult to precisely represent attributes and locate individual objects within the river system.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 全球水文模型及其输入数据库的主要限制与空间分辨率、数据结构和数据质量有关，这可能导致流域和水流属性的偏差和误表示。这些挑战使得精确表示属性和定位河流系统内的单个对象变得困难。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the effectiveness of integrating hydrological connectivity in data collection for large-scale river systems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在大规模河流系统的数据收集中整合水文连通性的有效性感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Hydrological connectivity is crucial in both hydrology and ecology as it integrates processes from multiple disciplines. However, implementing advanced connectivity in a global framework is challenging due to limitations in spatial resolution, data structure, and current models' capabilities to fully integrate these processes.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 水文连通性在水文学和生态学中至关重要，因为它整合了多个学科的过程。然而，在全球框架中实施先进的连通性面临挑战，原因在于空间分辨率、数据结构的限制，以及当前模型在全面整合这些过程方面的能力不足。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how a dataset can support multi-scale and integrated modeling approaches for hydro-ecological research.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解一个数据集如何支持水生态研究的多尺度和综合建模方法。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The integration of local or fine-scale information into global datasets presents challenges, such as the difficulty in accurately representing hydrodynamic processes, spatial resolution issues, and the need for enhanced data and modeling frameworks that facilitate the linkage between hydrological and ecological information.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 将地方或细尺度信息整合到全球数据集中面临挑战，例如准确表示水动力过程的困难、空间分辨率问题，以及需要增强的数据和建模框架，以促进水文和生态信息之间的联系。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please summarize the main challenges in collecting and integrating hydrological data for large-scale river systems in the Himalayan region.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn:
在喜马拉雅地区收集和整合大规模河流系统的水文数据面临的主要挑战包括：

1. **地理复杂性**：喜马拉雅地区地形复杂，河流系统分布广泛，导致数据收集困难。
2. **气候变化**：气候变化影响降水模式和水文循环，增加了数据的不确定性。
3. **缺乏基础设施**：许多偏远地区缺乏必要的监测设备和基础设施，限制了数据的获取。
4. **跨国界管理**：河流流域跨越多个国家，涉及不同的管理政策和数据共享协议，增加了整合的难度。
5. **数据标准化**：不同机构和国家使用不同的数据收集和处理标准，导致数据整合时出现不一致性。
6. **资金和技术限制**：缺乏足够的资金和技术支持，影响了数据收集和分析的能力。

这些挑战使得在喜马拉雅地区进行有效的水文数据收集和整合变得复杂且困难。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The main challenges include spatial resolution, data structure, quality of data, inclusion of hydrological connectivity, and support of multi-scale and integrated modeling approaches. These challenges arise due to difficulties in accurately representing stream and watershed attributes, the coarse spatial resolution of global hydrological models (GHMs), and the inability to accurately integrate fine-scale information.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 主要挑战包括空间分辨率、数据结构、数据质量、水文连通性的纳入，以及对多尺度和综合建模方法的支持。这些挑战源于准确表示河流和流域属性的困难、全球水文模型（GHMs）的粗糙空间分辨率，以及无法准确整合细尺度信息的问题。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please describe the methods used in the enhancement of global hydrographic databases and the development of river network routing models.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请描述用于增强全球水文数据库和开发河流网络路由模型的方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The methods described involve the enhancement of a global hydrographic database (HydroSHEDS) and the coupled development of a new river network routing model (HydroROUT) as the backbone of the framework. This approach facilitates the integration of hydrological and ecological information and supports hydro-ecological research and applications.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 所描述的方法涉及增强全球水文数据库（HydroSHEDS）以及新河流网络路由模型（HydroROUT）的联合开发，作为框架的基础。这种方法促进了水文和生态信息的整合，并支持水文生态研究和应用。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify potential datasets that could be utilized for improving hydrological modeling in large river systems and explain their relevance.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别可以用于改善大河流系统水文模型的潜在数据集，并解释它们的相关性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets include HydroSHEDS, which provides river and watershed information for regional and global-scale applications. It offers geo-referenced datasets at various resolutions, including river networks, watershed boundaries, and drainage directions. These datasets are crucial for facilitating hydro-ecological research and improving hydrological modeling by providing consistent and detailed geographical information.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集包括HydroSHEDS，它提供区域和全球尺度的河流和流域信息。该数据集以不同分辨率提供地理参考数据，包括河流网络、流域边界和排水方向。这些数据集对于促进水文生态研究和改善水文模型至关重要，因为它们提供了一致且详细的地理信息。
